title: **Active induction of experimental autoimmune uveoretinitis \(EAU)**
body: EAU was induced with 150µg bovine IRBP and 300µg human IRBP peptide \(1-20) in C57bl/6 strain. Disease was induced in B10RIII mice with 150µg bovine IRBP and 12-20 µg human IRBP peptide \(161-180) and clinical disease in both strains were established by fundoscopy and histology. Initial signs EAU is observed approximately 7-12 days after immunization, with full-blown disease developing by post-immunization day-14. By day-21 post-immunization there is substantial reduction of inflammatory cells and disease resolution characterized by absence of inflammatory cells or inflammatory cytokines in the retina occurs 28 days post-immunization<sup>6</sup>.

body.body: Into a 50 ml polypropylene tube, add 0.5 ml stock bovine IRBP protein \(6 mg/ml) and 6 mg lyophilized human IRBP peptide \(1-20) and bring mixture to a final volume of 2 ml
Add an equal volume or 2 ml of Complete Freund adjuvant \(CFA) containing Mycobacterium tuberculosis strain H37Ra \(2.5 mg/ml), mix and chill on ice for 10 min
Sonicate at high speed on ice for 20 seconds followed by 30 seconds intervals
Repeat 4-5 times until the mixture appears as a thick white cream.
Centrifuge at 1200 RPM for 1 min.
Prepare CFA emulsion without IRBP to serve as control.
Transfer emulsion into in 1 ml syringes with 19 gauge blunt-ended needles
Prepare PTX \(2 ug/ml) solution in 1 ml syringes with 25 gauge needles
Prepare sufficient PTX \(2 ug/ml) solution \(100µl/mouse)
Prepare sufficient CFA/Antigen emulsions \(200µl/mouse)
Before injections expel any air bubble in the syringe containing PTX or emulsion
Inject each mouse with PTX solution \(100 µl) intraperitoneally
Inject emulsion subcutaneously into base of tail \(100 µl) and each thigh \(50 µl)

Sacrifice the immunized at post-immunization day-7, -14, -21, and -28.


Controls: Un-immunized WT mice; mice immunized with CFA emulsion \(without IRBP)

title: **Clinical grading of mice with EAU by fundoscopy**

body.body: Restrain mice by anethesia: intraperitoneal injection of mixture of Ketamine and xylazine \(Rompun) at 30 mg/kg and 9 mg/kg, respectively.
After 5-10 min, dilate pupils by applying 1 drop of Mydriacyl \(1%) to each eye.
Gently press the cover glass on the cornea.
Adjust head position to focus retina to the fundoscope for examination

title: **Note**
body: : Mydriacyl causes temporary lens opacification within 15-20 min after application; it is important to complete examination within this time.

body.body: Incubate enucleated eyes overnight in 10% buffered formaldehyde
Embed eyes and cut 5µM paraffin sections in anterior/posterior orientation.
Stain sections in hematoxylin & eosin \(H&E).
Grading of EAU pathology is as previously described.

title: **Inhibition of EAU by IL-17 neutralizing antibody**

body.body: Active immunization of C57BL/6 mice with IRBP in CFA
Dilute IL-17 or IgD2a isotype control antibodies in PBS
Inject 500 µl IL-17 antibody \(350 µg) intraperitoreally into treatment group \(4 mice) 1 day before immunization with IRBP/CFA emulsion \(day -1).
Inject 500 µl IgD2a isotype control antibody \(350 µg) intraperitoreally into control group \(4 mice) 1 day before immunization with IRBP/CFA emulsion \(day -1).
Repeat Ab injection every other day until day 17 post-immunization.
Perform fundscopic examinations at post-immunization days 12, 14 and 16.
Sacrifice mice at post-immunization day-19 and perform histology

title: **IL-27 expression in PBMC or retina is temporally correlated with progression of EAU**

body.body: Immunise mice \(8) with CFA or IRBP/CFA emulsion
Monitor EAU progression by fundoscopy and histology
Sacrifice mice at post-immunization days, 0, 7, 14, 21 and 28
Section 1 eye for histology and stain with H&E
Isolate RNA and protein extracts from retina, PBMC or lymph nodes
Analyze IL-27 protein expression by Western blotting
Analyze IL27 and Ebi3 expression by RT-PCR and qPCR.
